intro: Vicia cracca var. pulchra, commonly known as the showy vetch, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its distinctive violet to purple flowers. The plant has trifoliate leaves and produces elongated pods that contain several seeds. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in meadows, roadsides, and waste areas. Vicia cracca var. pulchra is valued for its ornamental appeal and its ability to fix nitrogen in the soil.
